page.title: 18ALL SAINT'S CHURCH
page.content: All Saints Church is an extremely old church.Between 1335 and 1970 there have been 57 rectors.Now the church is redundant, only a couple of services are held each year.They are held by a society called the All Saints Society.The church itself is built of red brick.It is built on a hilltop. From the church you can see the interchange of the A128 Brentwood Tilbury road. Even though there are only 2 or 3 services a year chamber and choir concerts are held there as well.This building was becoming a ruin. It is now maintained by a trust fund which was set up by some Americans who came to England to trace their ancestors. They sent large donations to repair the church. In one of the walls is a heart.It belonged to a lady who was believed to be a witch.
